reviews.review_msg: Was skeptical about taking his class due to Ratemyprofs rating, but as the reviews state, there are 2 Richard Wong's (one in Acct and one not in Acct). Richard makes this known with the first class. If you look at his Ratemyprofs at UBC, you can see that this guy is the real deal. Take an accounting course with this guy, you won't regret it.

Be careful - there's two Richard Wong's at SFU - one that teaches accounting and one that does not. I had the one in accounting for income tax. Mad respect for this prof. Made a tough course easy to understand and was approachable during office hours. Would strongly recommend.
Not bad overall, the exams were easy compare to the lecture.
I miss Shiraz. He gave me such a good understanding of tax nobody else will ever compare

Engaging lectures.
Homework marked based on effort combination of Canvas and Pearson assignments.

Tests are fair - he tells you what's on it lol

GO TO LECTURE; if you don't, do be surprised you fail lol.

No pictures in his class so your notes have to be written/typed.

He is an excellent educator, and highly qualified individual. He incorporates stories from his actual experiences and what you learn is directly applicable to real life. Was the class difficult? Yes, but tax is difficult and so is the CFE. Growth requires you to be uncomfortable sometimes... and I'm okay with that.
Choose another instructor rather than her please!

She is the best professor I have at SFU. She is always friendly and clearly communicates what is important and what will be tested. For those who complained, it seems they aren't putting in the extra effort to attend office hours or stay after class for help.

A little too much reading off of the slides. I would recommend printing the slides and noting things she says that aren't already on the slides. Besides that, pretty average, but tax is a difficult topic, so maybe that means she's above average.

Teresa is a good professor. She explains the tax rules and concepts very clearly and states what will and will not be on the exams. During online instruction, she was very considerate to students and made lectures asynchronous while the scheduled class time was used as an (optional to attend) live review and Q&A session. Very approachable.

She is very helpful. She's so nice and kind. She even holds extra office hours. Tax is a hard course but she explains it so well. The exam is similar to a homework question. T/F is hard. if you like me bad at remembering tax rules. If you can take BUS 321 and BUS 331 with her.

Teresa is a great prof who is really committed to her students and ensuring they are learning the material. Her main goal is making sure that you are learning in the course and she can supplement your learning. She is clear on what you need to do to succeed in the course, its just up to you to put in the work!
She is the most caring and flexible professor who always care for her students. She is the best prof I've ever had
